detaileddescription.para: Generic Gattlink Client that exposes a "user side" data source and data sink to communicate "user data", and a "transport side" data source and data sink to connect to a "raw transport" that will transmit and receive the chunks of protocol data. This client manages an internal output buffer to allow the protocol to retransmit data if needed, and an internal input buffer to re-assemble protocol data into frames. The client uses a frame serializer to convert IP packets to a serialized form, and a frame assembler to reassemble received serialized frames into IP packets.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to struct implementing the GG_GattlinkClient interface
The configuration for the gattlink session. See GG_GattlinkSessionConfig for more details
instance of a timer scheduler to use for timers
Pointer to where the new object instance will be returned

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be created, or an error code.

briefdescription.para: Clear up any state associated with the object. After this call is made the object handle is no longer valid.

parameterdescription.para: The protocol to destroy

detaileddescription.para:
Should be called when the underlying transport is ready for communication. This will kick off a "Port Reset" sequence and whether or not it is succesful will be communicated via the a call to the client's NotifySessionUp implementation
protocol
The protocol to act on
GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

parameterdescription.para: The protocol to act on

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

briefdescription.para: Inform the GattLink layer that there is more data ready to be sent. This effectively primes GattLink to call the client's GattlinkGetOutgoingData implementation.

parameterdescription.para: The protocol to notify

briefdescription.para: Return the number of incoming bytes available for retrieving.

parameterdescription.para: The protocol to receieve data on

simplesect.para: The number of bytes available to be retrieved

briefdescription.para: Copy the requested amount of incoming data ready to be retrieved.

simplesect.para: The data cannot be free'd upon completion of this call. It can only be free'd when GG_GattlinkProtocol_ConsumeIncomingData() is called

parameterdescription.para: The protocol to retrieve data from
The index within the data buffer to start copying from
Pointer where to copy data to
Number of bytes to retrieve

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

briefdescription.para: Inform Gattlink when the received data has been successfully consumed.

detaileddescription.para:
Gattlink may now free any allocations associated with these bytes
protocol
The protocol to consume receive data from
size
The number of bytes to consume
GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

briefdescription.para: Inform Gatllink when new data is received over the transport layer. This data will be decoded and eventually result in a call to the client GattlinkNotifyIncomingDataAvailable implementation.

parameterdescription.para: The protocol that should handle raw data which is received
The data just received over the transport layer
The number of bytes to receive

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

memberdef.name: GG_GattlinkGenericClient_Create

detaileddescription.para: Create a new Gattlink client object.

parameterdescription.para: Timer scheduler used for retransmit and delayed ack timers.
Size of the circular buffer where data is held before being sent to the transport.
Maximum outgoing window size, or 0 to use the default value.
Maximum incoming window size, or 0 to use the default value.
Initial value of the maximum size that may be sent to the transport in a single packet. This value may be changed later by calling GG_GattlinkGenericClient_SetMaxTransportFragmentSize.
configuration of data probe. NULL to disable probe
Frame serializer object used to serialize packets/frames into outgoing stream data.
Frame assembler object used to assemble the incoming stream data into packets/frames.
Pointer to the variable in which the object will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be created, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Start the session.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the request succeeded, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Reset the client. This will flush internal buffers.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the request succeeded, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Set the maximum transport fragment size. This parameter has the same semantics as the one passed to the constructor. This method should be called if the underlying transport MTU changes and the maximum transport fragment size used by the Gattlink client should be updated accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Maximum size that may be sent to the transport in a single packet.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the request succeeded, or a negative error code.

briefdescription.para: The functions that deal with sending data from the local client out to the peer.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes ready to be sent

briefdescription.para: Copies the requested data ready to be transferred out to the peer device.

simplesect.para: The data cannot be free'd upon completion of this call. It can only be free'd when ConsumeOutgoingData() is called

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The index within the currently outstanding send data to start copying from
The buffer to copy the send data into
The number of bytes to copy

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

briefdescription.para: Called once the bytes have been successfully sent. Informs the client that it may free any allocations associated with these bytes.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The number of bytes that can be free'd

briefdescription.para: The functions that deal with receiving data from the peer and forwarding it to the client.

detaileddescription.para:
Called every time data has been successfully received by the peer and converted to a data payload that is ready for reading by the client
self
The object on which this method is invoked.

briefdescription.para: The low level APIs for sending & receiving raw 'GattLink' data.

detaileddescription.para: Informs GattLink the maximum payload size it can use. (i.e For a transport over GATT, this would be the negotiated MTU size minus the ATT Overhead)

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: the max size that can be provided to GetOutgoingData()

briefdescription.para: Called in order to send data over the underlying transport. See "Sending / Receiving Data Overview" in doc linked in header details.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The gattlink data to send over the underlying transport
The length of buffer

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS on success, or an error code

briefdescription.para: The APIs used to open/close a GattLink session.

detaileddescription.para:
Called when a session has been established and is ready to send/receive data
self
The object on which this method is invoked.

briefdescription.para: Called when a session has been reset. This is an indication to the client that it should assume that the peer has changed and/or reset its state. As a result, there is no guarantee that data sent prior to the reset has been successfully received by the peer, so the client is likely to need to flush some of its buffers and/or reset its state as well.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

briefdescription.para: Called when the communication with the peer is stalled for some period of time. It is not an indication that an error occurred, but an indication that there may be something wrong with the transport. It is up to the client to decide what to do when that happens, as the protocol will not automatically reset. This method may be invoked repeatedly by the protocol as it tries to continue to deliver packets to the peer and isn't receiving responses.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Number of milliseconds we have been stalled for so far.

detaileddescription.para: Event type emitted by a Gattlink client when the client buffer fullness is above a specified threshold. Useful when wanting to indicate important activity that could benefit from a faster connection.
The event struct is just a plain GG_Event. The event source is the GG_GattlinkGenericClient object that emits the event.
Event type emitted by a Gattlink client when the client buffer fullness is below a specified threshold. Useful when wanting to indicate lower activity that could justify using a slower connection.
The event struct is just a plain GG_Event. The event source is the GG_GattlinkGenericClient object that emits the event.
Event type emitted by a Gattlink client when a session is ready.
The event struct is just a plain GG_Event. The event source is the GG_GattlinkGenericClient object that emits the event.
Event type emitted by a Gattlink client when a session is being reset.
The event struct is just a plain GG_Event. The event source is the GG_GattlinkGenericClient object that emits the event.
Event type emitted by a Gattlink client when a session is stalled usually an indication the underlying transport isn't sending or receiving packets.
The event struct is a GG_GattlinkStalledEvent. The event source is the GG_GattlinkGenericClient object that emits the event.
Gattlink Protocol
